verb.description: Raise (something) by means of ropes and pulleys.
examples: high overhead great cranes hoisted girders

noun.description: An act of raising or lifting something.
The part of a flag nearest the staff; the vertical dimension of a flag.
A group of flags raised as a signal.

phrases: In 1814 he briefly hoisted his flag at sea, commanding the naval escort for Louis XVIII's return to France from his English exile.
Before their plans could come to fruition, though, they had a serious falling out, and on 2nd September 1966 he and his family took control of the tower on their own and hoisted their flag.
Iwo gave us the uplifting vision of the Marines hoisting the flag on enemy soil.
origin: Late 15th century: alteration of dialect hoise, probably from Dutch hijsen or Low German hiesen, but recorded earlier.
